page.title: 07FARMING IN CRUWYS MORCHARD 3
page.content: Machinery and electricity are vital and used extensively. Small units have one tractor each. Larger units have three or four plus trailers, loaders, mowers, dung-spreaders, combine- harvesters, balers, etc. Stationary equipment such as milking-machines, grain-augers and mills add to the large capital investment per hectare. Contractors are hired for most of the silage-cropping and harvesting and for the bulk of the hedge-trimming. Family labour is used on all farms. The farmer and a son or daughter share all outdoor work. This means twice-daily milking, tending of stock and calf-rearing. With lambing, cultivations and harvesting this amounts to an average twelve-hour day. The wife also contributes a few hours daily.
